seo.title: Santa Maria del Castello Hike from Hostel Brikette - Positano
seo.description: Complete hiking guide to Santa Maria del Castello village above Positano with directions, lookout points, and stunning coastal views.

linkLabel: Santa Maria del Castello: Mountain Village Hike
intro: Santa Maria del Castello sits at 670 meters (2,200 feet) above Positano, offering views that match or exceed those from the Path of the Gods. This mountain village features a restaurant with good food at affordable prices and stunning panoramic vistas.
Great views appear within just 15 minutes of departure from the hostel, making this a rewarding hike for those seeking flexibility and wanting to avoid crowded SITA buses.

sections.title: What is Santa Maria del Castello?
body: Your destination is a mountain village positioned above Positano at 670 meters (2,200 feet) elevation. The village features a restaurant offering good food at affordable prices, as well as great views.
A dedicated lookout point provides stunning panoramic views across the Amalfi Coast, Positano, and the surrounding mountains.

sections.title: Why should you do this hike?
body: Views match or exceed those from the Path of the Gods, offering spectacular coastal panoramas.
Great vistas appear within 15 minutes of departure from the hostel—you don't have to wait long for rewards.
Offers flexibility and is preferred by those avoiding crowded SITA buses.
Serves as a starting point for exploring other mountain areas around Positano.

sections.title: Important considerations
body: This hike is significantly more strenuous than the Path of the Gods. Be prepared for steep ascents.
May not suit those prioritizing the Path of the Gods experience as their main hiking goal.
Summer heat requires avoiding this hike between 11am and 4pm. Early morning or late afternoon departures are essential in warm months.

sections.title: Directions to the village
body: Follow these step-by-step directions from Hostel Brikette to reach Santa Maria del Castello village:

sections.title: Directions to the lookout point
body: Once you reach the crossroads where the trail levels out, follow these directions to access the stunning lookout point.

steps.name: Exit the hostel and turn right
steps.text: From the hostel entrance, turn right and ascend the steps beside the building.

steps.name: Continue on the footpath
steps.text: At the top of the initial steps, continue following the footpath upward.

steps.name: Choose left at the junction
steps.text: When you reach a junction, choose the left uphill option to continue ascending.

steps.name: Follow steps to the road
steps.text: Keep following the steps until you reach a point with stairs leading down to a road.

steps.name: Cross the road
steps.text: Cross the road and locate the stairs that run alongside the houses on the opposite side.

steps.name: Climb stairs behind houses
steps.text: Follow these stairs as they wind behind the houses, leading you up to the mountain trail.

steps.name: Continue on mountain trail
steps.text: Follow the mountain trail as it climbs toward the village. The path becomes more scenic here.

steps.name: Choose uphill at trail splits
steps.text: At two trail splits along the way, choose the uphill paths to continue toward the village.

steps.name: Reach the village crossroads
steps.text: You'll arrive at a crossroads where the trail levels out. This marks your arrival at Santa Maria del Castello.

steps.name: Turn right toward lookout (optional)
steps.text: To reach the lookout point, turn right at the crossroads.

steps.name: Take road uphill to junction
steps.text: Follow the road uphill until you reach a junction.

steps.name: Turn right at junction
steps.text: At the junction, turn right and follow the road as it curves rightward.

steps.name: Proceed to grassy section
steps.text: Continue until you reach a grassy section off the main road.

steps.name: Access vantage points
steps.text: The lookout vantage points are accessible from this grassy area. Use extreme caution—there are sudden drop-offs of several hundred meters.

warnings: Vantage points at the lookout have sudden drop-offs of several hundred meters. Stay well back from edges and supervise children closely.
This hike is significantly more strenuous than the Path of the Gods. Assess your fitness level before attempting.
Avoid hiking between 11am and 4pm during summer months due to extreme heat exposure on the mountain trail.
essentials: Sturdy hiking shoes with good grip for steep, uneven terrain
At least 1.5 litres of water per person—limited refill opportunities
Sun protection: hat, sunscreen, and sunglasses for exposed sections
Light snacks or lunch if planning to spend time at the village restaurant
tips: Start early in the morning during summer months to avoid the midday heat.
Take your time on the steep sections—the views are worth savoring along the way.
Consider having lunch at the village restaurant before descending back to Positano.
Bring a camera or fully charged phone—the photo opportunities from the lookout are exceptional.
